title: ClickTight Convertibles: Rear-Facing LATCH Installation
description:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in rear-facing mode using the LATCH System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in rear-facing mode using the LATCH System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.
For more information about Britax ClickTight convertible car seats, visit http://www.britaxusa.com/clicktight-convertibles

transcripts: Open the latch compartment at the back of the base and then remove the latch connectors. Open the click tight by pressing the dimple ball on the click tight dial and rotating the dial clockwise until it releases and lift to open. Recline the child seat and place rear facing on the vehicle seat. Pull the lower connector strap toward the child's left side and extend a full length . Find the lower connector strap into the rear facing belt sloths, firmly pressed lower connectors over there adjacent lower anchors. Verify that the connectors are secure and the strap is not twisted. Then pull the end of the lower connector strap to remove slack close the  click tight until a click is heard. The click tight logo must be in the horizontal position ensure that the ball on the recline indicator is within the allowable for the size of the child. If more recline is needed to seat can be reinstalled with a rolled towel or pool noodle under the front of the seat. Check that the child cannot be moved front to back or side to side more than one inch at the belt path. Rear facing installations can be improved by the use of the tether. See the rear facing tethering segment.
